ElfStringTable.C

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* ELF String Tables
00002  * 
00003  * String tables are represented with two main classes:
00004  *
00005  *    SgAsmElfStringSection is an SgAsmElfSection that contains a string table.  It points to an SgAsmElfStrtab.
00006  *
00007  *    SgAsmElfStrtab is a class representing the string table contained in an SgAsmElfStringSection. It inherits from
00008  *    SgAsmGenericStrtab.  An SgAsmElfStrtab points back to the SgAsmElfStringSection that contains it.
00009  */
00010 
00011 #include "sage3basic.h"
00012     
00014 void
00015 SgAsmElfStringSection::ctor()
00016 {
00017     get_name()->set_string("ELF String Table");
00018     if (get_size()==0)
00019         set_size(1);
00020     p_strtab = new SgAsmElfStrtab(this);
00021 }
00022 
00024 SgAsmElfStringSection *
00025 SgAsmElfStringSection::parse()
00026 {
00027     SgAsmElfSection::parse();
00028     ROSE_ASSERT(p_strtab);
00029     p_strtab->get_freelist().clear(); /*because set_size() during construction added to the free list*/
00030     p_strtab->parse();
00031     return this;
00032 }

00038 bool
00039 SgAsmElfStringSection::reallocate()
00040 {
00041     bool reallocated = SgAsmElfSection::reallocate();
00042     if (get_strtab()->reallocate(false))
00043         reallocated = true;
00044 
00045     /* Update parts of the section and segment tables not updated by superclass */
00046     SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *secent = get_section_entry();
00047     if (secent)
00048         secent->set_sh_type(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_STRTAB);
00049 
00050     return reallocated;
00051 }
00052 
00054 void
00055 SgAsmElfStringSection::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00056 {
00057     get_strtab()->unparse(f);
00058     unparse_holes(f);
00059 }
00060 
00063 void
00064 SgAsmElfStringSection::set_size(rose_addr_t newsize)
00065 {
00066     rose_addr_t orig_size = get_size();
00067     SgAsmElfSection::set_size(newsize);
00068     SgAsmGenericStrtab *strtab = get_strtab();
00069 
00070     if (strtab) {
00071         if (get_size() > orig_size) {
00072             /* Add new address space to string table free list */
00073             rose_addr_t n = get_size() - orig_size;
00074             strtab->get_freelist().insert(Extent(orig_size, n));
00075         } else if (get_size() < orig_size) {
00076             /* Remove deleted address space from string table free list */
00077             rose_addr_t n = orig_size - get_size();
00078             strtab->get_freelist().erase(Extent(get_size(), n));
00079         }
00080     }
00081 }

00084 void
00085 SgAsmElfStringSection::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00086 {
00087     char p[4096];
00088     if (idx>=0) {
00089         sprintf(p, "%sElfStringSection[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00090     } else {
00091         sprintf(p, "%sElfStringSection.", prefix);
00092     }
00093     
00094     SgAsmElfSection::dump(f, p, -1);
00095 
00096     ROSE_ASSERT(get_strtab()!=NULL);
00097     get_strtab()->dump(f, p, -1);
00098 
00099     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmElfStringSection) //unless a base class
00100         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00101 }

00105 void
00106 SgAsmElfStrtab::ctor()
00107 {
00108     ROSE_ASSERT(get_container());
00109     if (get_container()->get_size()==0)
00110         get_container()->set_size(1);
00111     p_dont_free = create_storage(0, false);
00112 }
00113 
00116 SgAsmElfStrtab *
00117 SgAsmElfStrtab::parse()
00118 {
00119     SgAsmGenericStrtab::parse();
00120     ROSE_ASSERT(get_container());
00121     if (get_container()->get_size()>0) {
00122         unsigned char first_byte;
00123         get_container()->read_content_local(0, &first_byte, 1);
00124         if (first_byte=='\0') {
00125             if (p_dont_free) {
00126                 ROSE_ASSERT(0==p_dont_free->get_offset());
00127             } else {
00128                 p_dont_free = create_storage(0, false);
00129             }
00130         } else if (p_dont_free) {
00131             p_dont_free = NULL;
00132         }
00133     }
00134     return this;
00135 }
00136 
00141 SgAsmElfStrtab::~SgAsmElfStrtab()
00142 {
00143     for (referenced_t::iterator i = p_storage_list.begin(); i != p_storage_list.end(); ++i) {
00144         SgAsmStringStorage *storage = *i;
00145         storage->set_strtab(NULL);
00146         storage->set_offset(SgAsmGenericString::unallocated);
00147     }
00148     p_storage_list.clear();
00149     p_dont_free = NULL; /*FIXME: can't delete for same reason as in SgAsmStoredString destructor. (RPM 2008-09-05) */
00150 }
00151 
00155 SgAsmStringStorage *
00156 SgAsmElfStrtab::create_storage(rose_addr_t offset, bool shared)
00157 {
00158     ROSE_ASSERT(offset!=SgAsmGenericString::unallocated);
00159 
00160     /* Has this string already been created? If so, return previous storage object. However, never share the empty_string at
00161      * offset zero created when this string table was constructed because the ELF spec says it needs to stay there whether
00162      * referenced or not. */
00163     if (shared) {
00164         for (referenced_t::iterator i=p_storage_list.begin(); i!=p_storage_list.end(); i++) {
00165             if ((*i)->get_offset()==offset && (*i) != p_dont_free)
00166                 return *i;
00167         }
00168     }
00169 
00170     /* Create a new storage object at this offset. */
00171     SgAsmStringStorage *storage = NULL;
00172     if (0==offset && 0==get_container()->get_data().size()) {
00173         ROSE_ASSERT(get_container()->get_size()>=1);
00174         storage = new SgAsmStringStorage(this, "", 0);
00175     } else {
00176         std::string s = get_container()->read_content_local_str(offset);
00177         storage = new SgAsmStringStorage(this, s, offset);
00178     }
00179 
00180     /* It's a bad idea to free (e.g., modify) strings before we've identified all the strings in the table. Consider
00181      * the case where offset 1 is "domain" and offset 3 is "main" (i.e., they overlap). If we modify "main" before knowing
00182      * about "domain" then we'll end up freeing the last part of "domain" (and possibly replacing it with something else)!
00183      *
00184      * The only time we can guarantee this is OK is when the new storage points to the same file location as "dont_free"
00185      * since the latter is guaranteed to never be freed or shared. This exception is used when creating a new, unallocated
00186      * string (see SgAsmStoredString(SgAsmGenericStrtab,const std::string&)). */
00187     if (p_num_freed>0 && (!p_dont_free || offset!=p_dont_free->get_offset())) {
00188         fprintf(stderr,
00189                 "SgAsmElfStrtab::create_storage(%"PRIu64"): %zu other string%s (of %zu created) in [%d] \"%s\""
00190                 " %s been modified and/or reallocated!\n",
00191                 offset, p_num_freed, 1==p_num_freed?"":"s", p_storage_list.size(),
00192                 get_container()->get_id(), get_container()->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str(),
00193                 1==p_num_freed?"has":"have");
00194         ROSE_ASSERT(0==p_num_freed);
00195     }
00196     
00197     p_storage_list.push_back(storage);
00198     set_isModified(true);
00199     return storage;
00200 }
00201 
00203 void
00204 SgAsmElfStrtab::rebind(SgAsmStringStorage *storage, rose_addr_t offset)
00205 {
00206     ROSE_ASSERT(p_dont_free && storage!=p_dont_free && storage->get_offset()==p_dont_free->get_offset());
00207     std::string s = get_container()->read_content_local_str(offset);
00208     storage->set_offset(offset);
00209     storage->set_string(s);
00210 }
00211 
00214 rose_addr_t
00215 SgAsmElfStrtab::get_storage_size(const SgAsmStringStorage *storage) {
00216     return storage->get_string().size() + 1;
00217 }
00218 
00225 void
00226 SgAsmElfStrtab::allocate_overlap(SgAsmStringStorage *storage)
00227 {
00228     ROSE_ASSERT(storage->get_offset()==SgAsmGenericString::unallocated);
00229     size_t need = storage->get_string().size();
00230     for (size_t i=0; i<p_storage_list.size(); i++) {
00231         SgAsmStringStorage *existing = p_storage_list[i];
00232         if (existing->get_offset()!=SgAsmGenericString::unallocated) {
00233             size_t have = existing->get_string().size();
00234             if (need<=have && 0==existing->get_string().compare(have-need, need, storage->get_string())) {
00235                 /* An existing string ends with the new string. */
00236                 storage->set_offset(existing->get_offset() + (have-need));
00237                 return;
00238             } else if (need>have && existing->get_offset()>=need-have &&
00239                        0==storage->get_string().compare(need-have, have, existing->get_string())) {
00240                 /* New string ends with an existing string. Check for, and allocate, free space. */
00241                 rose_addr_t offset = existing->get_offset() - (need-have); /* positive diffs checked above */
00242                 if (get_freelist().subtract_from(Extent(offset, need-have)).size()==0) {
00243                     get_freelist().allocate_at(Extent(offset, need-have));
00244                     storage->set_offset(offset);
00245                     return;
00246                 }
00247             }
00248         }
00249     }
00250 }
00251 
00253 void
00254 SgAsmElfStrtab::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00255 {
00256     SgAsmGenericSection *container = get_container();
00257     
00258     /* Write strings with NUL termination. Shared strings will be written more than once, but that's OK. */
00259     for (size_t i=0; i<p_storage_list.size(); i++) {
00260         SgAsmStringStorage *storage = p_storage_list[i];
00261         ROSE_ASSERT(storage->get_offset()!=SgAsmGenericString::unallocated);
00262         rose_addr_t at = container->write(f, storage->get_offset(), storage->get_string());
00263         container->write(f, at, '\0');
00264     }
00265     
00266     /* Fill free areas with zero */
00267     for (ExtentMap::const_iterator i=get_freelist().begin(); i!=get_freelist().end(); ++i) {
00268         container->write(f, i->first.first(), std::string(i->first.size(), '\0'));
00269     }
00270 }
